thread.title: France begins search for MH370 debris, although denies claims that more has been found
thread.title_full: France begins search for MH370 debris, although denies claims that more has been found

title: France begins search for MH370 debris, although denies claims that more has been found
text:
Save 
France is conducting land, sea and air searches around Reunion in a bid to try and spot more debris that could be linked to MH370. 
Malaysia announced on Thursday that a wing section found on the French Indian Ocean definitely had come from the missing Malaysia Airlines flight, however investigators in France have yet to confirm the link. 
France has also reportedly dismissed claims from Malaysia that more debris has been found. 
It comes as angry relatives staged a small protest outside the offices of Malaysia Airlines in Beijing, demanding the truth after receiving mixed messages from the authorities. 
The French government said in a statement that a military Casa aircraft would begin surveying the area around Reunion on Friday morning, along with helicopter and boat patrols, as well as search teams on foot, the BBC said. 
France said it recognised the pain for the families, and that it would play its full part in international efforts to “shed light on this tragedy”. 
The wing section that was found on Reunion, which is known as a flaperon, is being examined in the French city of Toulouse. 
Malaysian transport minister Liow Tiong Lai said paint and “many other technical details” on the flaperon tallied with MH370’s maintenance records. 
He added that window panes and seat cushions have also been found near Reunion which were yet to be identified. But French officials, have said no other debris has been recovered, stating only that there is a strong possibility that the flaperon came from MH370.
